website_summaries.verdict: This stylish, sophisticated bag is built to take a beating and loaded with features that make travel easier.
pros: Built to last, this quality bag features 4 high-performance sealed ball-bearing spinner wheels aligned with magnets
Nylon case is expandable and features top and side leather handles
Comes with garment bag attachment, nifty tie-down system and adjustable top handle
cons: Wheels can struggle over carpet and rough surfaces

customer_reviews.title: I travel frequently and have been a loyal Travelpro customer ...
customer_reviews.text: I travel frequently and have been a loyal Travelpro customer for 20 years. I bought 2 of these recently and returned 1 straightaway as it was missing a zipper pull. I now have 3 trips on the other and now this other bag is also missing a zipper pull. Came off in flight somewhere during luggage handling (I bag check). Have to say I have little confidence in the quality of the brand now and notice that fewer flight attendants use this bag compared to several years ago. I assume that it is the same quality issue. I will be moving on to other brand luggage.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Maneuver, But ...
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, this is a lightweight, well-equipped suitcase with rollers that track straight, making it easy to maneuver. Unfortunately, on my third flight with this bag, the front pocket zipper was broken off. I will update this once Travelpro responds to let you know how the warranty claim is handled.
customer_reviews.author: Get Rich Quick

customer_reviews.title: Broke Immediately, Warranty Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I've been loyal to Travelpro for years, but this may be the end. The zipper broke within days of buying it. After calling their customer service, they'll fix it but only if we pay for the shipping both ways! That's a joke of a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: R. Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Great until you use it
customer_reviews.text: Loved the suitcase until I got home. One zipper pull broken and the whole mechanism was broken off. How can this be fixed? I feel I paid for a sturdy case. Now I find it is not constructed with care. Too too bad. I will buy cheaper suitcases in the future as you do NOT get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Dolores F Charlock

customer_reviews.title: Ditto on the broken zipper problem
customer_reviews.text: Ditto on the broken zipper problem others have warned about. I thought I would spend a little extra to have a reliable suitcase. (I have had luggage break while traveling and it is a hassle.) However, on the very first trip the zipper pull broke. I purchased a couple of pieces of Travel Pro luggage in 2017. The features of the luggage seem nice enough, but a lifetime warranty is useless because they have few location for authorized repair. Generally, when a company offer a "worry free" warranty it means no problems but that doesn't seem to be the case. Living off their name seems to be the game.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Eudy

customer_reviews.title: Vulnerable Zipper Tabs
customer_reviews.text: On the second use of this suiter the front zipper tab broke off completely. Good luck trying to get this repaired when the closest TravelPro repair shop is over two hours away.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Would be better off with the smaller version
customer_reviews.text: Too big for a checked bag. Empty bag actually weighs 16 pounds. So, basically need to fill it halfway in order to avoid overweight fees. Which makes it pointless then, I don't need a roller bag for road trips! Would be better off with the smaller version. Wish I could return it but already used it on a couple flights and subsequently paid $150 in overweight fees.
customer_reviews.author: MrsE

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Luggage!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these suitcases for a recent trip to Costa Rica, and I am impressed by them! First, it is amazing the amount of stuff you can pack into one of them. We were able to pack two weeks of clothes and snorkeling gear! Next, the wheels are top-notch and allow the bags to roll over even cobblestones. The ergonomics of the handle is good, allowing easy push or pull. And the quality of the material and construction is very good. No question this is the best quality luggage we've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan Barcus

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles like R2D2
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for a trip to Europe and the wheels on one were immediately wobbly. The other case also began wobbling before the trip was over. We have all seen the commercial with gorillas throwing suitcases and the assumption that baggage handlers treat our things harshly BUT at $240 each these should be built to endure the torture any airline can throw at it. Also the zippers don't seem too durable either. In short, I'm disappointed with these and I regret paying full price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great carryon for Southwest
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. I fly Southwest regularly, and the fit is perfect in the overhead bin. This bag has the best rollers I’ve ever owned. I almost wasted my money on another Tumi—my old one had been repaired twice as the top handle kept detaching. This one looks much sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: morph

customer_reviews.title: I've purchased this product before and had good luck. Quality seems to have gone down significantly
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this product before and had good luck. Quality seems to have gone down significantly, however. Within a month of purchase and deployment of the product the zipper is broken. Travelpro wants me to spend 14 days getting it fixed instead of just shipping me a new one. I'd understand if the product weren't virtually brand new. The product quality and warranty aren't up to par.
customer_reviews.author: N. ENLOW

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Best. Luggage. Ever. This thing is ridiculously easy to move around. It is like cutting through semi-melted butter with a hot cleaver! The capacity is great too! I have not had to use the 'expansion' mode since it is able to accommodate many clothing items on it's own. Additionally, it was used a carry-on on Virgin with no problems. Only wish there were additional colors since so many bags look similar.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Lu

customer_reviews.title: Good for a bit then bad. Its not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of the magnetic wheels. They worked great at first but now the bag will not roll straight. It pull away from you or spin in circles. It need and exorcism, not a repair. Customer service isn't much help either. Their solution is for me to drive the bag over an hour away to a repair shop. So much for that "Worry Free Warranty.'' They should call it the "irritate the hell out of you warranty." I do love the inside of this luggage though.
customer_reviews.author: Fidel Castroll

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart and worthless warranty
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, but the wheel broke on the first use. The carry handle became unstiched and is coming off now. Warranty department is useless, must pay for shipping to have them repair or take to the closest repair shop over an hour and a half away, and I live in a major US city. Ridiculous. Will not be purchasing more travel pro luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal wheels
customer_reviews.text: As a fit middle-age flyer, I walk for 30 minutes on sidewalks to the metropolitan airport near my house. These wheels roll nicely on smooth concrete, asphalt, brick flooring, and even rougher surfaces. The suit compartment that flaps out and snaps-in is innovative and an excellent feature. Just be careful not to pack too many heavy items so you don’t go over the allowable 50 lbs because its easier to do with a suitcase this big.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Zipper is cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Be aware the zipper slider apparently is plastic and the pull tabs will eventually break off. 😡 The first tab broke off en route to Kraków the very first time I ever used it. The second broke off in my hand last week. Otherwise luggage is great if you can get it open.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: although still better than other brands out there
customer_reviews.text: Wheels are not as magical as the manufacturer will want you to believe. They have a tendency to keep shifting positions, although still better than other brands out there. Another con, a luggage this pricey should come with a TSA-compliant lock built-in to the frame. Instead, they'll send you a three-number padlock a few weeks after you send your registration form.
customer_reviews.author: Canarian

customer_reviews.title: I just used it for the first time and I loved it! It moves and glides so effortlessly and ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about this bag because it is heavier than my last bag and also a little smaller on the inside. However, I just used it for the first time and I loved it! It moves and glides so effortlessly and is so well balanced. Plus, it is a really elegant looking case. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shatzi

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We are 100k travelers annually. There is simply nothing like Travel Pro and this Maga unit is outstanding. The details like how easily the wheels role and how they 'lock' into a position is outstanding. My wife got some of that new "hot" branded luggage that is supposed to be great and cheap...it sucks. Was destroyed after 3 flights. It dented. Cracked....a waste. Get TravelPro. I have 1 unit that is 16 years old...
customer_reviews.author: Pappas

customer_reviews.title: Great Suitcase!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this suitcase after doing a bit of research and I am pleased with my decision. I recently travelled to and around Europe for a total of 8 flights and the suitcase did very well. I am also pleased with the size. I was away for over 2 weeks and there was more than enough space.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S

customer_reviews.title: Love TravelPro and their quality.
customer_reviews.text: TravelPro quality is on display again! I had this suitcase but in the carry on size. I needed a larger version as I was planning on taking an international trip for work. Found this on Amazon on sale as it was a previous years color. I’m glad I was able to get this one to match my smaller one. I love the quality of TravelPro. They are always the ones I turn to when looking for luggage. They are a bit more expensive but you get what you pay for with these guys!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great Piece, worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for international travel and have not been disappointed. Even when loaded to the max with my military uniforms/boots/gear still glides smoothly across most any surface. Handles well, hasn't shown any damage (I've flow internationally 3 times since I bought it in June). I bought a higher priced competitors piece (2x's this cost) and loaded it up...it did not roll as well as this when fully loaded. This is worth the cost and so far has been a great travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: CVreviews

customer_reviews.title: The Very Best Spinner
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for many months now and enjoyed outstanding performance of the spinner. I have had many other suitcases over the years and have always found TravelPro to be the best. TravelPro luggage are always well-designed and made of rugged materials that last for many years of hard use. This Platinum Magna 2 is simply the best spinner because of its outstanding maneuverability in addition to the great durability of TravelPro luggage. It is a real joy to use. Even after months of hard continued use, it is in perfect condition. I strongly recommend it for people who use luggage a lot and need a spinner.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I love that roll!
customer_reviews.text: Travelpro is my go-to for luggage. The platinum magna collection is just perfect for business travel. It sounds silly until you experience it, but I love the way these suitcases roll! I feels as though the whole thing just slides with zero effort required. You'll know what I mean after you try it. It's more than just that feeling you get with 360 rotation. It's better.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: This bag gets high reviews for a reason!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just returned from a trip using this luggage and I was extremely happy with the way it performed. I was able to pack it to the gills using storage envelopes and cubes. I packed for 6 days with bathing suits, coverups, 2 pairs of shoes, and outfits for day and evening. I was so pleased that the zippers were sturdy and the wheels worked seamlessly. After my husband saw how well it performed, he may well decide to get one to replace his more expensive bag that didn't perform as well.
customer_reviews.author: MBR

customer_reviews.title: Glides beautifully. Easy to pack
customer_reviews.text: Glides beautifully. Easy to pack. Like the compression system internally. The expansion part is only on the bottom portion to prevent the suitcase from toppling over when rolled. I really like that you can lower the handle some. We have checked it 3 round trips stuffed on continental US trips. So far it is wearing well.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Young

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and size. Hard to fit suits and dress shirts in.
customer_reviews.text: Wheels are great, very nice quality. I’m overall happy. My biggest issue is that I am a 42in in suites and the garment had barely fits in the suitcase. I have to bed the bad to get it in marking all my shirts and suites instantly wrinkled. The extra 2 wheels take up space. I’m not sure if the standers shanked for carry on, but I see much bigger 2 wheeled bags getting on planes. Another 2 inches in length would make all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: EMan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mix of size, quality and price.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were searching for the perfect luggage for our trip to Europe. We searched through all travel bags and concluded that this brand was the right mix of material, durability and price. It did not disappoint! We bought the entire set and it traveled well all throughout France and London! It was large and organized enough to handle our clothes and purchases. The only issue we had was that the zipper on the small pocket in the front was broken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mid-size suitcase.
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase is exactly what I needed. It is perfect for carrying suits or jackets in a separate compartment. The only thing is I noticed is the fab on the outside compartment zipper is missing. As soon as I arrive back in the US I will contact the seller to have the suitcase repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cannot recommend highly enough
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy - perfect carry on size. wheels are above the norm and most importantly, the handle system will not break off like others I have tried and rejected. you can always count on TravelPro
customer_reviews.author: SSC

customer_reviews.title: Great luggage at great value
customer_reviews.text: Great luggage at great value. i was able to manage 2 bags with one hand. Wheels roll very easily in every direction. the inside is lined very well and the extra hanging bag enclosed was a nice surprise. compartments are very practical. I also bought the less expensive version Travelpro Crew 11 21" which is also very good but i can tell the difference in the quality and worth the extra money. i kept both
customer_reviews.author: Nononsense

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: We are big Travelpro fans so when it came time to order a larger bag for trips when we check this one was a no brainer. I like the higher quality look and feel of this platinum line but pretty much anything Travelpro is bulletproof. The bag is surprisingly light for it’s size. It rolls really well even when we have it maxed out at 59 lbs. The included trifold suit/dress zip on attachment turns it into a solid garment bag with a ton of space for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Not Assigned

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I shopped for a new carry on for a few months and finally bought his one. No comparison unless you are will to spend 500 on a briggs and riley. 1 month and I have already bent one wheel and need to get it fixed. Will try to update review after that.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: This is THE suitcase to buy
customer_reviews.text: I think I'm in love. Without realizing it, I have been waiting my whole traveling life for a suitcase this perfect--lightweight yet with sturdy construction, well-structured and it operates oh-so smoothly. No more sore shoulders, or suitcases I have to put effort into moving from point A to point B. A great investment financially--because you buy it once and use it for years. And more importantly, it's a suitcase that eases and improves the travel experience.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: the rest of the bag is great. The inside has less storage area than I ...
customer_reviews.text: This says it rolls straight but I haven't had a situation where it does. That said, the rest of the bag is great. The inside has less storage area than I thought but it's because the bag really is very sturdy and the spine takes up a little room inside. I bought packing cubes but they're not needed, this has everything else it needs. I like this a lot and am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great Carry-On, Easy to Move
customer_reviews.text: Have had this now for about 6-months. Usually use a larger 2-wheeled carry-on that I check. This is so nice that I am trying to pack lighter to be able to use this smaller case. If I'm careful, I can go for a week's business trip to Europe with this and I am increasingly relying on this instead of my 24 inch two-wheeler. Rolls easily, careful packing makes it more useful.
customer_reviews.author: John Winner

customer_reviews.title: perfection
customer_reviews.text: i had mediocre suitcases from like samsonite and others before this that i randomly bought at TJ Maxx's, but omg so happy i decided to invest in a travelpro suitcase, what a gamechanger. the design is nice and the way it spins so smoothly/easily is a DREAM. i love that it rolls upright without me having to pull it behind me. brilliant. this is a great carry-on size, fits all i need for a quick trip.
customer_reviews.author: xq

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for 2 years - then the retractable handle stops working.
customer_reviews.author: G. L. Tirebiter

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to premium priced brands.
customer_reviews.text: The magna-wheels aren't all they're cracked up to be but the overall build quality and zippers feel very solid. A little on the small size but fits in most overhead bins very easily. Nearly as nice as a comparable Tumi I just paid about twice as much for.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kloentrup

customer_reviews.title: Too Heavy, External Pockets not lockable!
customer_reviews.text: This moderate sized spinner suitcase had the perfect packing volume - 85 or 7 liters expandable to 92 liters It, however, was too heavy - 9.9 lbs which is nearly 10 lbs before one even packs it with belongings. Then, I didn't like the fact that the zippers on the 2 exterior pockets couldn't be locked.
customer_reviews.author: Brasileira

customer_reviews.title: Top notch spinner suitcase
customer_reviews.text: The superior construction materials and design distinguish this case. The double spinner wheels make it the most stable, maneuverable unit I've seen. All the internal features that can be there, are. and this one is perfect for carry on in airplanes.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in Rye Brook

customer_reviews.title: This was an awesome piece of luggage
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a trip to New York by train. This was an awesome piece of luggage. More sturdy than the Travelpro Crew 21. It handled enough for a 4 day trip. Down the streets to the subway and uptown to Manhattan. First Class piece of luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Strong and beautiful luggage.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this on several international flights and it still looks brand new. Also like fact that the stickers that airports and hotels apply to outside are easily taken off. Use packing cubes in this and they fit uniformly in this case. It rolls very easily and the leather handle looks good. This does not have locks. I returned many supposed luggage pieces of this quality where the locks broke as there was not enough support for integrated locks on bag this large.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: It's hasn't even been a year and the front zipper ...
customer_reviews.text: It's hasn't even been a year and the front zipper is completely gone. United airlines won't let my husband use it anymore bc of the front pocket zipper. Think long and hard before buying this suitcase, it doesn't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Dials

customer_reviews.title: Broken zipper on second trip
customer_reviews.text: We've had Magna spinners and liked them a lot. We had a broken zipper on one. This is the second time it's happened, this time only one month after we bought it. Too late to return -- and it looks like a pattern of problems
customer_reviews.author: Helaine

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Even empty, it feels pretty heavy -- with airlines being so strict about weight, this might be a bit of a concern. If you're not flying then it's perfect -- very maneuverable, rolls smoothly, feels very durable and solid. Nice leather trim and handle.
customer_reviews.author: Madam Pince

customer_reviews.title: Let's roll
customer_reviews.text: Travelpro is my go-to for luggage. The platinum magna collection is just perfect for business travel. It sounds silly until you experience it, but I love the way these suitcases roll! I feels as though the whole thing just slides with zero effort required. You'll know what I mean after you try it. It's more than just that feeling you get with 360 rotation. It's better.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: The suitcase is beautiful and well made
customer_reviews.text: The suitcase is beautiful and well made, the only problem for me is the size. It may be my mistake from misunderstanding the description and pictures, but the only "suit" fitting in this suiter would be for a teenager. I wear a 42R jacket and it would not fit in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Madw3rld

customer_reviews.title: This suitcase came highly recommended from several traveling blog sites
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase came highly recommended from several traveling blog sites, which is why I purchased it leading up to a 2 week European vacation. During the vacation we visited 5 countries by plane, train, subway, taxi and foot. On day 1 of the trip, the telescoping handle would not extend beyond the first position and it remained this way for the remainder of the trip. While the rest of the bag appears well made, the telescoping handle has a major design flaw. Unless you enjoy carrying your luggage, I'd recommend against buying this model until the telescoping handle is re-engineered.
customer_reviews.author: SKis_CO

customer_reviews.title: Buy this suitcase and you'll never have to buy another one again
customer_reviews.text: Awesome suitcase. Who knew suitcases could be SO great? Easy, easy, easy and strong. Loved mine so much I purchased the larger one, and also purchased a pair of this one for my parents as an anniversary gift. Offer my highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Good suitcase, just a little big and boxy.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this suitcase but it is bigger and boxer than I expected. I wish the inside straps were elastic and not adjustable clips. And I have had trouble with the hanging items staying in place when using the built-in suiter. I am happy with it, but it's not exactly what I expected. It does maneuver very well and seems well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia G. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Another Great product from TravelPro
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag to replace another name brand 4-wheeler and I prefer the TravelPro over the others. Well made design and holds a lot of clothes. Have only had it for a little over one month, but it still looks new after being handled by several airport baggage attendants. The wheels are the best part of the bag. The bag stays in the same line as you walk with it through the airport. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Edward M.

customer_reviews.title: My only issue with it is that there are no more detailed instructions as to how best to use all the elements it is supposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: Came on time. It was as advertised. I has numerous pockets. My only issue with it is that there are no more detailed instructions as to how best to use all the elements it is supposed to have and use,
customer_reviews.author: Ina B. Russakoff

customer_reviews.title: Small, easy to maneuver carry-on, smartly constructed. Buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a small, easy to maneuver, smartly constructed carry-on, buy with confidence! Well made, but really not for me as looks go (I'm a significantly less convenient, leather duffle-type).
customer_reviews.author: Steen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing durability
customer_reviews.text: I have had this suitcase for less than 2 years, and the zipper pulls are far from durable. Both of the lock rings on the main compartment zippers, as well as one of the main compartment zipper pulls have broken off. In addition the zipper pull on the upper outside compartment has also broken off. I initially bought this item thinking it would be durable for someone like me who travels a lot, because I see lots of flight crews with the same brand. It has not lived up to my expectations. Unfortunately, the nearest warranty repair site is 150 miles away. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Goldn1

customer_reviews.title: Best rolling luggage for the money. You wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a road warrior and after a lot of research, I've found this to be the best rolling bag for the money. You lose a little space with the channels for the handle, but this thing rolls like it's on air. Best piece of luggage I've ever used, and I've got a million miles under my belt.
customer_reviews.author: Lyzak

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality little carry on. Has a remarkable amount of room for it's size. Compartments are very convenient too. It is very sturdy and I love that there is almost no play in the handle. Wheels are very reliable. A dream to take along.
customer_reviews.author: NJS

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Comes up a tiny bit smaller visually but it has tons of room. Fits perfectly overhead on a 737. The spinner wheels are amazing and honestly make the whole walking bit 10 times easier. You get a suit bag included and handy waterproof compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hendey

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Easy rolling
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Quality hardware. Sturdy. Easy rolling. Aesthetically pleasing. It's not black!! I'd buy it again. I also bought the Travelpro carryon case that fits on top- perfect combo. This set up has simplified my travel. Now my luggage is one less hassle during my travels.
customer_reviews.author: White Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Great suitcase!  Highly recommend!  25" Platnum Magna 2 (25")
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time on a trip to London. Packed well and rolled smoothly and straight. Was able to hook my TP backpack on the handle instead of carrying the backpack. I highly recommend this suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Trip

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic Wheels are Sweet
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag for a consulting internship over the Summer and it worked extremely well. I was forced to check it several times as well and it has solid durability (I was worried about wheels being popped off or damaged). I think this is the best value you can get if you travel for work.
customer_reviews.author: John Richards

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret buying Travel Pro luggage
customer_reviews.text: Using Travel Pro since 2005. This is our 3rd set of luggage. The other two sets are still working just fine. Made the first upgrade to get 4 wheels on the ground and this upgrade because I got tired of my wife ‘overpacking’ the 29” suitcase. We do a lot of traveling - an average of 12 weeks a year and the combination of the 25” suitcase and the 21” carry-on seems to be the best combination we have found, so far. Never had any serious complaints with Travel Pro luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Symington

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Yes you can get a cheaper case. This case is very well made. Excellent quality and workmanship. The wheels are excellent, sturdy and roll very easlly. If you travel lots, this is an essential travel accessory. The handle mechanism slides in and out very smoothly. Very happy with this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Francois Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: Great suitcase, but broken zipper after 2 trips
customer_reviews.text: Great suitcase, rolls extremely well, spacious. Unfortunately, within the first couple of uses, a zipper on the front compartment broke off completely, making it unusable. Have had this bag less than six months, so not a good testament to the quality. Hopefully this is an anomaly, and I am initiating a warranty claim now, which I’m hoping will be addressed promptly by TravelPro.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Good, but it will roll away on you
customer_reviews.text: I like this suitcase, but it does roll away from you if you aren't careful. The wheels turn so easily that if you aren't paying attention and are on a hill, it will roll. You might turn your back and find that it's several feet away!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lynch

customer_reviews.title: The Best Bag for Long Trips and/or Multiple Travellers
customer_reviews.text: This is a bag you check, for a longer trip. It holds an enormous amount but is difficult to over-pack, and I have never gone over the airline weight limits. Rolls beautifully, lots of thoughtful details and lovely finishes. Looking to purchase the carry-on size next.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeful Reader

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Well built piece of luggage. What sealed the deal for me was the lifetime warranty, including damage by the airlines.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but tips over when it has your laptop.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this bag is great, but it has one big defect. The only practical place to put your laptop (e.g. my MacBook) is in the front sleeve. But when you do that it puts too much weight on the front and the bag tips over easily, because the wheels don't support something sticking out like that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a year, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.text: Zippers failed before we even had it a year. Hard to find a good suitcase these days and this sadly, is not it. Loved the storage capacity, the spinner wheels and the areas to store items were efficient for traveling, unfortunately not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thought this was supposed to be 'top quality'????
customer_reviews.text: After many years of travel we decided to spend more money to purchase a top of the line bag so we ended up with this TravelPro bag. After one trip the entire outside zipper was ripped off! We didn't immediately notice this after our trip so the airlines will certainly not cover this. We have traveled on many many trips with different types of luggae and this has never happened before. Very disappointed with the quality of this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Matt

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Light!

customer_reviews.title: Nice luggage

product_meta.title: Travelpro Platinum Magna 2-Softside Expandable Spinner Wheel Luggage, Black, Carry-On 21-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:Carry-On 21-Inch| Color:BlackThe epitome of style, Travelpro Platinum Magna 2 luxury performance luggage is crafted with premium, ultra-durable fabrics and intelligent design innovations, making it ideal for frequent business travel and personal trips. This expandable suit bag features eight MagnaTrac self-aligning wheels that provide effortless 360-degree rolling whether you’re arriving or departing and can be expanded incrementally up to two inches to maximize storage. The upright suitcase also features a patented telescoping handle that extends to three lengths: 38-in., 40-in., and 42.5-in. Other features include a cushioned Contour Grip for comfort and control, damage-resistant SUPRA zipper heads, a removable garment sleeve to keep clothes wrinkle-free, and a deluxe tie-down system with built-in accessory pockets to keep your clothing, shoes, and personal items neat and organized. The high-quality ballistic nylon fabric features DuraGuard coating to help protect against stains and abrasions due to airline handling. This Fit to Fly carry-on spinner has been sizer been tested to accommodate overhead bin space on most major US airlines. Fully expanded Carry-On may not meet airline restrictions. Backed by our built for a Lifetime Limited Worry-Free Warranty that covers the cost of repair for damage from airline or other common carrier for the life of the bag after registration under the trusted companion promise.
